explanation: The bug was in the condition `if judge(a) + judge(b) == 2:`. That only detects the case where both a and b are in the first group (both return 1), but misses the case where both are in the second group (both return 2). The correct check is to see whether a and b belong to the same group, i.e. `judge(a) == judge(b)`. I replaced that single line accordingly.
